content.description: Start on the far right (south) side of the west face. From there, traverse the obvious rail, and top out on the apex of the face. This is a great problem on a good boulder, and it's super close to the road.
content.location: This is on the West face of the Miller Block. Start on the southwest corner.

content.description:
Starch the New Year climbs a decent section of overhanging rock. It has enjoyable movement that requires thoughtful hand and foot placement.

Sit start matched on a layback jug. From there, gain a right hand sidepull, walk your feet over to a heel hook, gain an incut left hand, follow to a right hand edge next to it, stick a big right hand crossover edge, gain the left hand jug, use the bumps to gain position, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of the Miller Block in between

Reed College Professional

and

My Friend Bob

.

content.description: Start low on two crimps on the right side of the west face. Move up to a good easy sloper (it's a big move however) and top out on the slopers and bumps.
content.location: It's on the right side of the west face and the downclimb is obvious once you're on top.

content.description: Start on the left slope and the right hand crimp on a tender flake right in the middle of the west face. Move upward and try avoiding the huge jug in the middle of the face. I don't know that it changes the grade, it just makes it a bit more interesting.
content.location: The problem is located right smack in the middle if the west face of the Miller Block. There's an obvious downclimb on the back.

content.description:
Start in the same area as

Blue Like Jazz

, and head up and right. Top out on the obvious point of the west face. Staying low will make the problem a bit more difficult while going to the huge rail will obviously make it easier.
content.location: Start in a good hueco and crimp as you move up and right. There's an obvious down climb on the back.

content.description: Sit start with a good right hand and sloping left hand. Move up using crimpy side pulls and delicate feet. Move to the top of the feature and then top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There's a small boulder and a cactus underneath, just FYI.
content.location: You'll see the start on the left-center of the west face. There's an obvious down climb after topping out.

climbs.name: A Million Miles in a Thousand Years

content.description: Start low on the far right side of the west face and head up and left using good slopers and crimps. Top out on slopers and bumps at the apex.
content.location: The downclimb is on the back side of the boulder.
